00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 # pygame + PyOpenGL version of Nehe's OpenGL lesson09
00003 # Paul Furber 2001 - m@verick.co.za
00004 
00005 import os, random
00006 from OpenGL.GL import *
00007 from OpenGL.GLU import *
00008 import pygame, pygame.image, pygame.key
00009 from pygame.locals import *
00010 
00011 
00012 textures = []
00013 stars = []
00014 twinkle = 0
00015 zoom = -15.0
00016 tilt = 90.0
00017 spin = 0.0
00018 
00019 
00020 class star:
00021     """ simple star class that (hopefully) demonstrates
00022     how to move functionality out of a main loop and into
00023     an object - the logic remains unchanged from the
00024     original tutorial C code"""
00025     def __init__(self, index, max=50):
00026         self.angle = 0.0
00027         self.index = index
00028         self.max = max
00029         self.dist = (1.0 * index/max) * 5.0
00030         self.r = random.randrange(0,256)
00031         self.g = random.randrange(0,256)
00032         self.b = random.randrange(0,256)
00033 
00034     def draw(self):
00035         glBegin( GL_QUADS )
00036         glTexCoord2f( 0.0, 0.0 ); glVertex3f( -1.0, -1.0, 0.0 )
00037         glTexCoord2f( 1.0, 0.0 ); glVertex3f(  1.0, -1.0, 0.0 )
00038         glTexCoord2f( 1.0, 1.0 ); glVertex3f(  1.0,  1.0, 0.0 )
00039         glTexCoord2f( 0.0, 1.0 ); glVertex3f( -1.0,  1.0, 0.0 )
00040         glEnd( )
00041 
00042     def set_color(self):
00043         glColor4ub(self.r, self.g, self.b, 255)
00044 
00045     def orient(self):
00046         global zoom, tilt, twinkle, stars
00047         glLoadIdentity( )
00048         glTranslatef( 0.0, 0.0, zoom )
00049         glRotatef( tilt, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0 )
00050         glRotatef( self.angle, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0 )
00051         glTranslatef( self.dist, 0.0, 0.0 )
00052         glRotatef( -self.angle, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0 )
00053         glRotatef( -tilt, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0 )
00054         if twinkle:
00055             self.r = stars[self.max - self.index - 1].r
00056             self.g = stars[self.max - self.index - 1].g
00057             self.b = stars[self.max - self.index - 1].b
00058             self.set_color()
00059             self.draw()
00060         glRotatef( spin, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0 )
00061  
00062     def update(self):
00063         global spin
00064         self.orient()
00065         self.set_color()
00066         self.draw()
00067         spin += 0.01
00068         self.angle += 1.0*self.index / self.max
00069         self.dist -= 0.01
00070         if ( self.dist < 0.0 ):
00071             self.dist += 5.0
00072             self.r = random.randrange(0,256)
00073             self.g = random.randrange(0,256)
00074             self.b = random.randrange(0,256)
00075 
00076 def resize((width, height)):
00077     if height==0:
00078         height=1.0
00079     glViewport(0, 0, width, height)
00080     glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION)
00081     glLoadIdentity()
00082     gluPerspective(45, 1.0*width/height, 0.1, 100.0)
00083     glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW)
00084     glLoadIdentity()
00085 
00086 def init():
00087     global stars
00088     
00089     glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D)
00090     load_textures()
00091     glShadeModel(GL_SMOOTH)
00092     glClearColor(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
00093     glClearDepth(1.0)
00094     glHint(GL_PERSPECTIVE_CORRECTION_HINT, GL_NICEST)
00095     glBlendFunc( GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE )
00096     glEnable(GL_BLEND)
00097     for x in range(50):
00098         stars.append(star(x))
00099 
00100 def load_textures():
00101     global textures
00102     
00103     texturefile = os.path.join('data','star.bmp')
00104     textureSurface = pygame.image.load(texturefile)
00105     textureData = pygame.image.tostring(textureSurface, "RGBX", 1)
00106 
00107     textures = glGenTextures(2)
00108     
00109     glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D, textures[0])
00110     glTexParameteri(GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_LINEAR)
00111     glTexParameteri(GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_LINEAR)
00112     glTexImage2D( GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, GL_RGBA, textureSurface.get_width(), textureSurface.get_height(), 0,
00113                   GL_RGBA, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, textureData )
00114     
00115 def draw():
00116     global stars
00117     
00118     glClear( GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT | GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT )
00119     glBindTexture( GL_TEXTURE_2D, textures[0] )
00120     glLoadIdentity( );
00121     for x in range(50):
00122         stars[x].update()
00123 
00124 
00125 def handle_keys(key):
00126     global tilt, zoom, twinkle
00127     
00128     if key==K_ESCAPE:
00129         return 0
00130 
00131     if key==K_UP:
00132         tilt += 2.0
00133     elif key==K_DOWN:
00134         tilt -= 2.0
00135     elif key==K_PAGEUP:
00136         zoom += 0.5
00137     elif key==K_PAGEDOWN:
00138         zoom -=0.5
00139     elif key==K_t:
00140         twinkle = not twinkle
00141 
00142     return 1
00143 
00144 def main():
00145 
00146     global surface
00147 
00148     video_flags = OPENGL|DOUBLEBUF
00149     
00150     pygame.init()
00151     surface = pygame.display.set_mode((640,480), video_flags)
00152     pygame.key.set_repeat(100,30)
00153 
00154     random.seed()
00155     resize((640,480))
00156     init()
00157 
00158     frames = 0
00159     done = 0
00160     ticks = pygame.time.get_ticks()
00161     while not done:
00162         while 1:
00163             event = pygame.event.poll()
00164             if event.type == NOEVENT:
00165                 break
00166             if event.type == KEYDOWN:
00167                 if handle_keys(event.key) == 0:
00168                     done = 1
00169             if event.type == QUIT:
00170                 done = 1
00171         
00172         draw()
00173         pygame.display.flip()
00174         frames += 1
00175 
00176 
00177     print "fps:  %d" % ((frames*1000)/(pygame.time.get_ticks()-ticks))
00178 
00179 
00180 if __name__ == '__main__': main()
